snippet: Shortly before Miguel Adrover's return to the runway tonight after a roughly eight-year absence (not counting the small presentations he has made for a German eco-label called Hessnatur), I stopped backstage to say hello.
abstract: Shortly before Miguel Adrover's return to the runway tonight after a roughly eight-year absence (not counting the small presentations he has made for a German eco-label called Hessnatur), I stopped backstage to say hello.
lead_paragraph: Shortly before Miguel Adrover's return to the runway tonight after a roughly eight-year absence (not counting the small presentations he has made for a German eco-label called Hessnatur), I stopped backstage to say hello. Mr. Adrover, a designer who sort of looks like Jesus, was studying a model who was wearing what looked like half of a tropical rainforest, with sharp bones protruding from her jaws.
